senses.sense_definition: A common surname of English and Scottish origin, originally referring to the occupation of a miller.

examples.text: Mr. <w>Miller</w> has lived in this neighborhood for over twenty years.
We invited the <w>Millers</w> to dinner next Saturday.

senses.sense_definition: A male given name derived from the surname.

examples.text: They decided to name their son <w>Miller</w> after his grandfather.
<w>Miller</w> will be joining our team next week.

senses.sense_definition: A name given to various towns, communities, and locations in the United States, Canada, and Australia.

examples.text: The small town of <w>Miller</w> is located just off the main highway.
She grew up in <w>Miller</w>, a quiet community in the Midwest.

senses.sense_definition: A person who owns or operates a mill, especially one that grinds grain into flour.

examples.text: The <w>miller</w> worked from dawn until dusk grinding wheat for the village.
In the story, the <w>miller</w> was known for his strength and hard work.

senses.sense_definition: A machine used for milling, shaping, or cutting metal and other solid materials.

examples.text: The factory installed a new <w>miller</w> to increase production speed.
He learned to operate the precision <w>miller</w> during his apprenticeship.

senses.sense_definition: Any of several types of moths that have powdery, white or pale wings.

examples.text: A large white <w>miller</w> fluttered around the porch light all evening.
The dusty wings of the <w>miller</w> left a mark on the windowpane.
